intro: Calibrachoa sendtneriana, commonly known as the dwarf petunia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. This species is characterized by its compact growth habit and profuse display of small, colorful flowers. The plant typically blooms throughout the growing season, producing clusters of star-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and containers due to its vibrant appearance and ease of care.
